alert.note: Alert for Alger; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 4:20AM EST until February 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, lake effect snow and considerable blowing snow expected. Snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches this afternoon through tonight across Alger County and the higher terrain of Marquette County. Snow accumulations this afternoon and tonight will be one inch or less from Republic to Arnold. North to northwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph this afternoon and evening in open areas near Lake Superior. For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow and patchy freezing drizzle this morning. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch this morning. * WHERE...Marquette and Alger Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult this afternoon and tonight. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Along M-28 between Marquette and Munising, occasional white-out conditions will develop in the mid to late afternoon and continue through this evening. Hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero late tonight could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling this morning. If you must travel this afternoon or tonight. keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
